rows.ORIGIN PROBLEMS: The original problem set that created the Trade. 68 problems across 10 categories.
Source: spreadsheet_automation_problems_solutions.md (Nilo's raw thinking) + Vicioso Problems & Solutions tab
These are the problems. The Trade is the answer. Every design decision traces here.

rows.col_2: Problem
rows.col_4: Trade Solution

rows.col_2: Company creation is artisanal — can't hire someone to finish/execute a 45% complete operating model
rows.col_3: Can't scale, can't delegate, everything depends on one person. The core problem.
rows.col_4: Standardize into 103 TUPs with tab structure, grading, AI co-pilot — anyone can execute from artifact alone

rows.col_2: Solution must be cheap and easy — no elaborate enterprise systems
rows.col_3: Complex solutions won't be maintained or adopted. Google Workspace + spreadsheet or nothing.
rows.col_4: Spreadsheet + Drive + Calendar + AI = entire system. $0 beyond Google Workspace.

rows.col_2: Unclear what's AI frontier vs organizational complexity
rows.col_3: Might be solving wrong problems or using wrong tools. Some problems are prompting problems, some are org design problems.
rows.col_4: Human-in-the-loop design. AI co-pilot augments, librarian routes, expert grades. Test which is which.

rows.col_2: Fix 45% complete system vs start from single paragraph?
rows.col_3: Wrong approach wastes enormous effort. Growth approach has different problems than fix approach.
rows.col_4: Both. Trade IS the paragraph grown into 1181 tabs. IonWave proves it works.

rows.col_2: Compression vs Comprehensiveness — when to zoom 100x vs stay high-level
rows.col_3: Over-complicate simple things OR over-simplify complex things. No framework for deciding.
rows.col_4: TUP tab structure defines zoom level. P-tab = compressed scope. C-tabs = expanded detail. Expert decides if depth is right.

rows.col_2: Problem
rows.col_4: Trade Solution

rows.col_2: Each tab has dependencies to other tabs — can't edit in isolation
rows.col_3: Change in one place breaks another
rows.col_4: Cross-TUP Dependencies tab + librarian integrity checks

rows.col_2: Information change propagation — don't know what's affected
rows.col_4: Dependency map updated after each change; librarian propagates

rows.col_2: A single word can blow up the system
rows.col_3: Catastrophic failures from small edits. Non-obvious high-impact terms.
rows.col_4: Conceptual Index: 500-700 words per term prevents semantic drift

rows.col_2: Working memory overflow — 103 TUPs exceed human capacity
rows.col_3: Can't see whole system, miss connections
rows.col_4: Cluster structure groups TUPs; conductor sequences; dashboard shows state

rows.col_2: No cognitive scaffolding — no visualization of dependencies
rows.col_3: Have to manually trace connections every time
rows.col_4: Tab Dependencies Map + Drive structure mirrors Trade hierarchy

rows.col_2: Attention fragmentation — context-switching destroys flow
rows.col_3: Lose train of thought after 4 tab switches
rows.col_4: Flash sprints: one cluster at a time, 2-3 weeks. No tab switching.

rows.col_2: Can't comprehend relationships — dependencies invisible
rows.col_4: MC narrative layer makes relationships legible in conversation

rows.col_2: Can't project future states — 'if I change this, what breaks?'
rows.col_4: Snapshot + test + rollback. Librarian checks cross-references.

rows.col_2: Don't know sequencing of tab creation — circular dependencies
rows.col_4: Cluster architecture defines build sequence. M0 thesis → clusters.

rows.col_2: Expansion creates version control nightmares
rows.col_3: Half tabs reflect old model, half new
rows.col_4: TUP versioning: imagination locks on grade ≥ B. Amendments logged.

rows.col_2: Problem
rows.col_4: Trade Solution

rows.col_2: Each tab is not completed — placeholders, empty columns, missing logic
rows.col_4: Expert grading: nothing locks below B. P-tab defines what complete means.

rows.col_2: No vision for what each tab should look like
rows.col_3: Don't know what 'done' looks like. No reference.
rows.col_4: P-tab = scope + spec. Reference models tab has examples.

rows.col_2: No defined way to audit each tab
rows.col_3: Bad work passes, good work unrecognized
rows.col_4: ACP grading: Attestation (true?), Completeness (everything?), Plausibility (works?)

rows.col_2: No clear stopping criteria
rows.col_4: Grade ≥ B = lock. Not perfect, good enough to execute from.

rows.col_2: No shared vocabulary — terms mean different things
rows.col_4: Conceptual Index with 500-700 word definitions

rows.col_2: Implicit assumptions not captured
rows.col_3: Claude makes different assumptions than you
rows.col_4: Assumptions register with kill criteria. Validation conversations.

rows.col_2: 100 rounds of feedback until right
rows.col_3: Time and cost blow up, fatigue sets in
rows.col_4: Templates encode learning — AI starts at round 95, not round 1

rows.col_2: Levels of abstraction not obvious to LLMs
rows.col_3: Claude doesn't flag 75% close rate is 15x industry standard
rows.col_4: Expert review catches what AI can't. Benchmarks in P-tabs.

rows.col_2: Problem
rows.col_4: Trade Solution

rows.col_2: Can't find reference models — best-in-class examples unavailable
rows.col_4: Reference Models tabs + Reference Deck - Shuman + expert networks

rows.col_2: Lost context between sessions — reasoning disappears
rows.col_3: Repeat same mistakes, rediscover same insights
rows.col_4: Artifact IS the context. Post-mortems capture lessons. Templates persist.

rows.col_2: Every prompt starts cold — no accumulated knowledge
rows.col_4: Templates ARE accumulated knowledge. AI co-pilot reads the Trade.

rows.col_2: Can't compose or reuse proven prompts
rows.col_3: When prompt works, can't apply to similar tabs
rows.col_4: Prompt library = Trade tab templates. Reuse across TUPs.

rows.col_2: No prompt performance history
rows.col_4: Post-mortems track what worked. Grade history shows patterns.

rows.col_2: Novel situations not captured — edge cases fall through
rows.col_4: NO TEMPLATE flag → new template within 2 weeks (QMS)

rows.col_2: Knowledge stays in one person's head
rows.col_4: Lesson from PM A → template → PM B uses without Nilo

rows.col_2: Problem
rows.col_4: Trade Solution

rows.col_2: Spreadsheet not easy for human to read vs narrative
rows.col_4: MC narrative layer. Start Here tab. OOUP essay converts to prose.

rows.col_2: Can't zoom to important pieces during different conditions
rows.col_4: Dashboard + breaking points + conductor sequencing

rows.col_2: Improving tabs requires more space than pure AI compute
rows.col_4: Drive folder per cluster. Working docs alongside artifact.

rows.col_2: Claude doesn't have compute for full system
rows.col_4: Chunk by cluster, not by tab. Librarian routes context.

rows.col_2: Prioritization is manual — which tab next?
rows.col_4: Conductor sequences. Dependencies auto-trigger priority.

rows.col_2: Founder is the bottleneck
rows.col_3: Can't scale, burnout, single point of failure
rows.col_4: Flash teams execute from artifact. Founder sets initial conditions only.

rows.col_2: System can't run without founder for 30 days
rows.col_4: THIS IS THE CORE RESEARCH QUESTION. Can artifact replace founder?

rows.col_2: Problem
rows.col_4: Trade Solution

rows.col_2: Not a repeated profile — need rare skill combo
rows.col_4: PM co-founder model: Claude competency + domain curiosity. Test via sprint.

rows.col_2: Requires a recruiter
rows.col_3: Time investment to recruit is substantial
rows.col_4: MC pipeline + Nilo outbound + operator search tracker

rows.col_2: Don't have money to pay market rate ($150-200/hr)
rows.col_4: Equity model: 0.3-0.5% per sprint vesting on grade ≥ B

rows.col_2: No infrastructure to make it appealing to do for free
rows.col_4: The Trade IS the infrastructure. 1181 tabs = professional artifact.

rows.col_2: They may not complete it — no binding commitment
rows.col_4: Equity vests on grade. No grade = no equity. Sprint structure = small commits.

rows.col_2: Don't have someone to manage them
rows.col_4: Artifact manages: tabs + rubric + verification items = self-managing

rows.col_2: Not actually aligned when they start
rows.col_4: P-tab defines scope. ACP grading provides objective criteria. Expert grades, not founder.

rows.col_2: Quality control bottleneck — you still review everything
rows.col_3: Review takes as long as doing it
rows.col_4: Multi-grader system: AI → Librarian → Expert. Founder overrides only.

rows.col_2: Async communication overhead
rows.col_3: 2-week sprint becomes 6 weeks from Q&A latency
rows.col_4: AI co-pilot answers most questions. Librarian routes the rest. Zero meetings.

rows.col_2: Commitment uncertainty — might quit halfway
rows.col_4: Sprint structure: 2-3 week commits. Context in artifact, not in person's head.

rows.col_2: IP/confidentiality concerns
rows.col_3: No legal protection; they could replicate
rows.col_4: PM agreement: IP assignment, equity vesting, NDA. Entity structure.

rows.col_2: Iteration friction — they want team environment
rows.col_4: MC creates community. Expert reviewers provide interaction. Eventually PM cohort.

rows.col_2: Don't know who commercializes — handoff undefined
rows.col_4: PM does BOTH: imagination (build) AND implementation (launch). No handoff.

rows.col_2: Can't structure deal to own 80% when unincorporated
rows.col_4: Platform structure upfront: equity splits clear from day 1.

rows.col_2: Don't know how to get people to commit
rows.col_4: Sprint commitment is binary. Test sprint first. Equity only on grade.

rows.col_2: Problem
rows.col_4: Trade Solution

rows.col_2: Can't identify high-risk vs low-risk components
rows.col_4: Expert reviewers decide depth. Critical-path TUPs get dual review.

rows.col_2: Can't detect load-bearing vs scaffolding elements
rows.col_3: Some components break everything if wrong, some don't matter
rows.col_4: Essential variables define load-bearing. Dependencies show cascading risk.

rows.col_2: Can't decide verification depth per component
rows.col_3: No principle for allocating testing effort
rows.col_4: TUP criticality rating in P-tab. Higher criticality = deeper review.

rows.col_2: Non-obvious high-impact words can blow up system (UNSOLVED)
rows.col_3: Can't predict which words matter until they explode
rows.col_4: Conceptual Index helps. But this remains genuinely unsolved. The paper should acknowledge it.

rows.col_2: Problem
rows.col_4: Trade Solution

rows.col_2: No rollback mechanism — improvements that break things can't be undone
rows.col_4: TUP versioning. Imagination locks. Amendments create new versions.

rows.col_2: No version control or change tracking
rows.col_3: Can't see what changed, changes happen without awareness
rows.col_4: Drive version history + librarian change log + sprint reports

rows.col_2: No observability layer — can't debug failures
rows.col_4: Post-mortems required. Sprint reports. Grade commentary.

rows.col_2: No evaluation metrics
rows.col_4: ACP grading. Grade history. Cumulative TUP grades.

rows.col_2: No error budgets or graceful degradation
rows.col_4: Breaking points define thresholds. Conductor manages degraded mode.

rows.col_2: No invariants — no properties that must always be true
rows.col_4: Librarian checks structural invariants. Dependencies must be consistent.

rows.col_2: Problem
rows.col_4: Trade Solution

rows.col_2: How do you unfold a single paragraph into 200 tabs?
rows.col_3: No methodology for expanding narrative to structure
rows.col_4: Trade Anatomy + TUP template + cluster structure. Paragraph → levels → clusters → TUPs → tabs.

rows.col_2: Don't know right checkpoints for validating expansion
rows.col_3: Can't tell if on right path during build
rows.col_4: Phase gates (P-tab → AI draft → librarian review → expert grade)

rows.col_2: No protocols to zoom in at different levels
rows.col_4: Level hierarchy: Trade → Passet → Level → Cluster → TUP → Tab

rows.col_2: Going to lower levels reveals higher-level insights
rows.col_4: Post-mortems surface learnings. Templates updated. New TUPs created if gap found.

rows.col_2: No clear place to define unfolding logic
rows.col_4: S4-Taxonomy defines hierarchy. P-tabs define per-TUP unfolding.

rows.col_2: Don't know sequencing of tab creation
rows.col_4: Dependency Graph + cluster architecture defines sequence. M0 first, always.

rows.col_2: No way to validate digital twin is 'complete'
rows.col_3: Might have 200 tabs but missing core components
rows.col_4: Failure Scenarios enumerate what can go wrong. If not covered → add TUP.

rows.col_2: Expansion creates version control nightmares
rows.col_3: Half tabs reflect old model, half new
rows.col_4: Imagination lock on grade. Amendments create new version. Old version preserved.

rows.col_2: Principle
rows.col_4: Where Implemented

rows.col_2: Verification items as universal currency
rows.col_3: Everything uses 'can a stranger execute this?' — contracts, QMS, payments, progress
rows.col_4: Grading System tab, V-tabs in every TUP

rows.col_2: Two-pass always: narrative → component
rows.col_3: First understand the whole, then fix parts. Never fix everything at once.
rows.col_4: TUP Lifecycle: librarian (structural) → expert (substance)

rows.col_2: Session = single atomic improvement
rows.col_3: Each sprint produces one scored, logged improvement per cluster
rows.col_4: Sprint structure, conductor sequencing

rows.col_2: Prompt library is architecture
rows.col_3: The templates ARE the system, not implementation details
rows.col_4: P-tabs = encoded prompts. Tabs = reusable prompts.

rows.col_2: Grading replaces completion
rows.col_3: Nothing is ever 'done' — just scored. Decide when good enough to stop.
rows.col_4: Grading System: A-F scale. B = lock threshold.

rows.ORIGIN PROBLEMS: TOTAL: 65 problems across 9 categories. 5 design principles. 1 unsolved (GAP-4: non-obvious high-impact words).
CROSS-REFERENCE: S41-Problem Doc maps 21 of these to the research paper. Vicioso Problems & Solutions has the original 68.
THE CLAIM: The Trade architecture, as implemented in IonWave's 1181 tabs, is a proposed solution to all 64 solved problems.
